intro: Triodanis coloradoensis, commonly known as the Colorado larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, rocky areas and has hairy stems and leaves. It produces small, green, ribbed fruits that contain seeds. Triodanis coloradoensis is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
